answers.answer: You may have incompetant veins in the foot that prevent the fluids from pushing back up to the heart.  I would get the leg dopplered to rule out a clot.  If you had congestive heart failure or COPD (lung disease), you would have swelling in both legs.If you do have incompetant veins, a pair of compression stockings will help.Go to your local pharmacy or medical supply store to get: knee high compression stockings with a gradient of 10-20 mmHG of compression.
